sentence.text: Pattern of potential drug-drug interactions in diabetic out-patients in a tertiary care teaching hospital in Nepal.
A prospective study was conducted at Manipal Teaching Hospital, Pokhara, Nepal to identify and analyze the pattern of the potential DDIs (drug-drug interaction) in diabetes patients
A total of 182 patients who were prescribed 685 drugs (average, 3
Patients 51 to 60 years of age had a higher risk [43 patients, or (23
1%) of the potential DDIs were of "moderate" severity
Cardiovascular drugs carried a risk of DDIs (187 drugs, or 49
The most common potential DDI observed was between metformin and enalapril (n = 64)
